content: उत्थान {%<ab>a.</ab>%} Causing to arise or spring up. --नं {@--1@} The act of rising or standing up, getting up; शनैर्यष्ट्युत्थानं <ls>Bh. 3. 9.</ls> {@--2@} Rising (as of luminaries); इंदुं नवोत्थानमिवेंदुमत्यै <ls>R. 6. 31</ls> newly risen. {@--3@} Rise, origin. {@--4@} Resurrection. {@--5@} ({%a%}) Effort, exertion, activity; मेदश्छेदकृशोदरं लघु भवत्युत्थानयोग्यं वपुः <ls>Ś. 2. 5</ls>; °शीलः <ls>Dk. 153</ls> disposed to work; <ls>Mv. 6. 23</ls>; यद्युत्थानं भवेत्सह <ls>Ms. 9. 215</ls>, effort (for money), acquisition of property. ({%b%}) Manly exertion, manhood. {@--6@} Energy. {@--7@} Joy, pleasure. {@--8@} War, battle. {@--9@} An army. {@--10@} Evacuating (by stool &c.). {@--11@} A book. {@--12@} A court yard. {@--13@} A shed where sacrifices are offered. {@--14@} A term, limit, boundary. {@--15@} Business (cares &c.) of a family or realm. {@--16@} Reflection. {@--17@} Proximate cause of a disease. {@--18@} Awakening.
